AFC East.blurb: The Jets are officially going to get more than one play out of Aaron and win this competitve division with a talented roster
A team that has lost some talent but still has a good overall chance to win quite a few games.
If Tua Tagovailoa stays healthy, expect the Dolphins to challenge for the top spot.
The are actually so poopy I don't even have a positive thing to say.

AFC North.blurb: This Ravens team has struggled to top the mountain but they always find a way to be successful in the regular season
The Browns have talent and this year Stefanski manages to simplify the offense for a more productive year.
A rebuilding year for the Steelers, as they search for their next real quarterback but somehow they stumble once again into a winning season
The Bengals struggle slightly this year and unfortunately in this tough division that means they have a below expectation finish.

AFC South.blurb: The Texans have finished their rebuild and are firing on all cylinders to claim this mediocre division.
The Colts have potential and with a healthy season from Richardson and a good campaign from JT they find their way a bit more.
A young team with promise, but the Jaguars are still finding their way.
This team is on a downward trend and headed toward a rebuild. Although they've picked up some new talent, it won't be enough this year.

AFC West.blurb: Patrick Mahomes and the Chiefs are the clear favorites to dominate the AFC again.
With Justin Herbert at the helm again we get to find out if Harbaugh can turn this aging ship around.
The Broncos are going to be quite bad but hopefully they can learn from their mistakes.
Despite some talent, the Raiders face too many obstacles to climb higher in this stacked division (like starting Gardner at QB).

NFC East.blurb: Jalen Hurts and a strong defense make the Eagles a serious contender.
The Cowboys' could compete heavily this season but will find a way to lose the big games.
The Commanders need stability at quarterback to challenge the top teams. Hopefully Jayden Daniels is the answer to their search.
The Giants are still rebuilding but picked up a new stud WR. Unfortunately they just paid Danny Dimes $40 mil a year.

NFC North.blurb: Jordan Love and the Pack reclaim their spot atop the NFC North.
The Lions are immaculate vibes and I would love for them to win this division but they struggle a bit in the regular season this year.
The Bears newly revamped offense and Caleb Williams lead them to a respectable first campaign in a tough division.
The Vikings are a solid team, but they'll need to overcome the loss of a promising JJ McCarthy to compete this year and it seems like they won't be able to do so.

NFC South.blurb: The Falcons and Kirko Chains lay a beating on a truly awful division.
Baker Mayfield leads the Bucs to a respectable 2nd in a soft division.
The Saints manage to survive a year when they should give up and admit that they are in desperate need of a rebuild
The Panthers struggle once again but start to show some signs of promise with a young QB who is establishing himself a bit.

NFC West.blurb: With their elite defense and strong run game, the 49ers are the team to beat in the NFC West.
The Seahawks could surprise a few teams this season. A new coach shakes up the Hawks enough to win a few extra games.
The LA Rams struggle to compete in a tough division and ultimately finish below expectations.
The Cardinals face a tough schedule and may struggle to keep up with their division rivals.
